com.exacttarget.etpushsdk

Class ETPushConfig.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.exacttarget.etpushsdk.ETPushConfig.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    ETPushConfig

    public static class ETPushConfig.Builder
extends Object
    Build a new ETPushConfig instance to bootstrap your app with the SDK.

    Calling the following methods is required before calling build():

    • setEtAppId(String)
    • setAccessToken(String)
    • setGcmSenderId(String)

    Calling the following methods is optional before calling build():

    • setAnalyticsEnabled(boolean)
    • setWamaEnabled(boolean)
    • setLocationEnabled(boolean)
    • setCloudPagesEnabled(boolean)
    • setCloudPageRecipientClass(Class)
    • setOpenDirectRecipientClass(Class)
    • setNotificationRecipientClass(Class)
    • setNotificationAction(String)
    • setNotificationActionUri(Uri)
    • setNotificationResourceId(int)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ETPushConfig.Builder(android.app.Application application)
      The Application class is required because the SDK must bootstrap with your app for background tasks.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ETPushConfig build()
      Create the ETPushConfig which will bootstrap your app to the SDK.
      ETPushConfig.Builder setAccessToken(String accessToken)
      Sets the Access Token to be used when the SDK communicates with the SFMC.

      Sets the Application ID to be used when the SDK communicates with the SFMC.

      Sets the Google Cloud Messaging (GCM) Sender ID to be used to send Push Messages.

    • Method Detail

      • build

        public ETPushConfig build()
        Create the ETPushConfig which will bootstrap your app to the SDK.

      • setEtAppId

        public ETPushConfig.Builder setEtAppId(String etAppId)
        Sets the Application ID to be used when the SDK communicates with the SFMC.
        Parameters:
        etAppId - the Application ID of the MobilePush app defined in App Center that will be used to send pushes to your Android app

      • setAccessToken

        public ETPushConfig.Builder setAccessToken(String accessToken)
        Sets the Access Token to be used when the SDK communicates with the SFMC.
        Parameters:
        accessToken - the Access Token of the MobilePush app defined in App Center that will be used to send pushes to your Android app

      • setGcmSenderId

        public ETPushConfig.Builder setGcmSenderId(String gcmSenderId)
        Sets the Google Cloud Messaging (GCM) Sender ID to be used to send Push Messages.
        Parameters:
        gcmSenderId - the GCM Sender ID as defined in your GCM Developers console documented in Google Cloud Messaging Docs.

      • setAnalyticsEnabled

        public ETPushConfig.Builder setAnalyticsEnabled(boolean analyticsEnabled)
        Specifies whether you would like to collect Analytic data which can be viewed in the MobilePush section of your SFMC account.

        Analytics are collected within the SDK and are sent to your SFMC account when your app goes into the background.

        To ensure the SDK knows that your app goes into the background, you must notify the SDK anytime an Activity is resumed or paused for Android SDK prior to version 14. This is accomplished using the methods:

        ETPush.activityResumed(Activity)
        ETPush.activityPaused(Activity)

        If you target versions of Android 14 or later, then we will put in callbacks for onResume() and onPause() to determine when your app has gone into the background.
        Parameters:
        analyticsEnabled - true or false

      • setPiAnalyticsEnabled

        @Deprecated
public ETPushConfig.Builder setPiAnalyticsEnabled(boolean piAnalyticsEnabled)
        Deprecated. 

      • setWamaEnabled

        public ETPushConfig.Builder setWamaEnabled(boolean wamaEnabled)
        Specifies whether you would like to collect Web and Mobile Analytic data which can be viewed in the Web and Mobile Analytics section of your SFMC account.

        Analytics are collected within the SDK and are sent to Web and Mobile Analytics when your app goes into the background.

        To ensure the SDK knows that your app goes into the background, you must notify the SDK anytime an Activity is resumed or paused for Android SDK prior to version 14. This is accomplished using the methods:

        ETPush.activityResumed(Activity)
        ETPush.activityPaused(Activity)

        If you target versions of Android 14 or later, then we will put in callbacks for onResume() and onPause() to determine when your app has gone into the background.
        Parameters:
        wamaEnabled - true or false

      • setLocationEnabled

        public ETPushConfig.Builder setLocationEnabled(boolean locationEnabled)
        Specifies whether you would like to enable Location Messaging within the SDK for your app.

        Note: This is a paid add-on to MobilePush and should only be enabled if you are displaying location based messages that are setup within your SFMC MobilePush account. Enabling this feature adds additional requests for messages from your SFMC account as well as enables location services on each Android device that uses your app.

        Messages are downloaded from the MobilePush app in your SFMC account whenever the app comes into the foreground.

        To ensure the SDK knows that your app comes into the foreground, you must notify the SDK anytime an Activity is resumed or paused for Android SDK prior to version 14. This is accomplished using the methods:

        ETPush.activityResumed(Activity)
        ETPush.activityPaused(Activity)

        If you target versions of Android 14 or later, then we will put in callbacks for onResume() and onPause() to determine when your app has gone into the background.
        Parameters:
        locationEnabled - true or false

      • setProximityEnabled

        public ETPushConfig.Builder setProximityEnabled(boolean proximityEnabled)
        Specifies whether you would like to enable Proximity Messaging (for BLE Beacons) within the SDK for your app.

        Note: This is a paid add-on to MobilePush which is currently in beta testing and should only be enabled if you are displaying proximity based messages that are setup within your SFMC MobilePush account. Enabling this feature adds additional requests for messages from your SFMC account as well as enables BLE services on each Android device that uses your app.

        Messages are downloaded from the MobilePush app in your SFMC account whenever the app comes into the foreground.

        To ensure the SDK knows that your app comes into the foreground, you must notify the SDK anytime an Activity is resumed or paused for Android SDK prior to version 14. This is accomplished using the methods:

        ETPush.activityResumed(Activity)
        ETPush.activityPaused(Activity)

        If you target versions of Android 14 or later, then we will put in callbacks for onResume() and onPause() to determine when your app has gone into the background.
        Parameters:
        proximityEnabled - true or false

      • setCloudPagesEnabled

        public ETPushConfig.Builder setCloudPagesEnabled(boolean cloudPagesEnabled)
        Specifies whether you would like to enable CloudPage Inbox Messaging (Rich Pages) within the SDK for your app.

        Note: This is a paid add-on to MobilePush and should only be enabled if you are displaying CloudPage (Rich Page) messages that are setup within your SFMC MobilePush account. Enabling this feature adds additional requests for messages from your SFMC account as well as enables BLE services on each Android device that uses your app.

        Messages are downloaded from the MobilePush app in your SFMC account whenever the app comes into the foreground.

        To ensure the SDK knows that your app comes into the foreground, you must notify the SDK anytime an Activity is resumed or paused for Android SDK prior to version 14. This is accomplished using the methods:

        ETPush.activityResumed(Activity)
        ETPush.activityPaused(Activity)

        If you target versions of Android 14 or later, then we will put in callbacks for onResume() and onPause() to determine when your app has gone into the background.

        To display the CloudPages that are downloaded, we have provided an ArrayAdapter where the SDK will populate the CloudPages that are downloaded from your SFMC MobilePush account. See CloudPageListAdapter for more information.
        Parameters:
        cloudPagesEnabled - true or false

      • setCloudPageRecipientClass

        public ETPushConfig.Builder setCloudPageRecipientClass(Class<?> cloudPageRecipientClass)
        Sets the class that should receive the CloudPage URL contained in a standard alert message. The URL for the CloudPage will be delivered in the bundle of extras included with the alert message with a string extra "_x" included.

        If you do not set this value, the SDK will default to using ETLandingPagePresenter to show the contents of the CloudPage url.

        Note that you must define this class (or the ETLandingPagePresenter) in your Android Manifest file.
        Parameters:
        cloudPageRecipientClass - the class containing the Activity to display your CloudPage alert message

      • setOpenDirectRecipientClass

        public ETPushConfig.Builder setOpenDirectRecipientClass(Class<?> openDirectRecipientClass)
        Sets the class that should receive the OpenDirect URL contained in a standard alert message. The URL for OpenDirect will be delivered in the bundle of extras included with the alert message with a string extra "_od" included.

        If you do not set this value, the SDK will default to using ETLandingPagePresenter to show the contents of the OpenDirect url.

        Note that you must define this class (or the ETLandingPagePresenter) in your Android Manifest file.
        Parameters:
        openDirectRecipientClass - the class containing the Activity to display your CloudPage alert message

      • setNotificationRecipientClass

        public ETPushConfig.Builder setNotificationRecipientClass(Class<?> notificationRecipientClass)
        Sets the class that should be opened when your customer taps the notification. This activity will only be opened if the payload sent within the alert message does not contain a url for a CloudPage or OpenDirect.

        If you do not set this value, the SDK will default will be to launch the application's Launcher activity.

        Note that you must define this class (or the ETLandingPagePresenter) in your Android Manifest file.
        Parameters:
        notificationRecipientClass - the class containing the Activity to be displayed when your customer taps a notification that does not contain a OpenDirect or CloudPage url.

      • setNotificationActionUri

        public ETPushConfig.Builder setNotificationActionUri(android.net.Uri notificationActionUri)
        Sets the Intent data URI to use when a notification is clicked. You must also call setNotificationAction(String) to launch a notification intent using this method.
        Parameters:
        notificationActionUri - URI to use for notification intent

      • setNotificationAction

        public ETPushConfig.Builder setNotificationAction(String notificationAction)
        Sets the action parameter of the intent to be fired when a notification is received. For example, you might pass something like Intent.ACTION_VIEW. You must also call setNotificationActionUri(Uri) to launch a notification intent using this method.
        Parameters:
        notificationAction - the intent action type to use when launching notification

      • setNotificationResourceId

        public ETPushConfig.Builder setNotificationResourceId(int notificationResourceId)
        Each notification requires an icon to meet the specs provided by Google. Android 5.0 enforces those standards as documented in Android Icon Styles
        Parameters:
        notificationResourceId - Resource id of the icon to use for the notification

      • setLogLevel

        public ETPushConfig.Builder setLogLevel(int logLevel)
        Set the default level of logging in the ExactTarget MobilePush SDK. By default will be set to Log.WARN from Android Log
        Parameters:
        logLevel - set from Android Log
